story.text: In April 2018 the first instance for sex workers appeared. This was in response to the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stop_Enabling_Sex_Traffickers_Act SESTA] act in the US, which made the more mainstream sites nervous about hosting anything which might be related to sex work of any kind, and as a consequence began the large scale purging of accounts which might be related to that.

Switter quickly gained many users. The adult industry was always a significant innovator on the internet - especially in the early days. The pseudo-privacy which Mastodon offered via its "followers-only" posts no doubt was an attractive feature which enabled some degree of discression to be maintained.

There was also some overlap between the interests of sex workers and the traditional anarchist user base of GNU Social, in terms of being marginalized communities which contain an above average level of solidarity and mutual aid.
